Platonism unveil'd, or, An essay concerning the notions and opinions of Plato and some antient and modern divines his followers, in relation to the Logos, or word in particular, and the doctrine of the trinity in general : in two parts. Platonisme déviolé. English Souverain, Matthieu, d. ca. 1699.
[4], 39 p.
s.n.], [London? : 1700.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. Attributed to Matthieu Souverain. cf. NUC pre-1956. Errata: p. [4]
=======
